definition: to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely

sentences.english: To do my duty, for the good of mankind in general.
sentences.chinese: 要善盡職責，爲全人類謀求福祉。

sentences.english: The cowardly officer was disgraced for failing to do His duty.
sentences.chinese: 這卑怯的官員因不盡職被解職。

sentences.english: And fulfill their duties than the spirit of personal prestige is more important.
sentences.chinese: 恪盡職守的精神比個人的聲望更重要。

sentences.english: Due diligence, the success rate of my near-perfect piece of work.
sentences.chinese: 盡職盡責中，成就了我一幅幅近乎完美的作品。

sentences.english: In the early period, the Warders would have performed their duties in plain clothes.
sentences.chinese: 早期時間，守衛盡職時只有穿著普通服飾。

sentences.english: The marshal is very responsible, and always waters the horses at Tian River.
sentences.chinese: 弼馬溫盡責盡職，經常到天河去飲馬。

sentences.english: Our spirit is more important than personal prestige.
sentences.chinese: 恪盡職守的精神比個人的聲望更重要。

sentences.english: She is really dutiful and responsible for her students.
sentences.chinese: 她對學生是盡心盡職的。

sentences.english: They wanted a generation of Americans conditioned to loyalty and duty.
sentences.chinese: 他們都想把一代美國人培養得忠於祖國，恪盡職守。

sentences.english: Very few politicians are doing their duty towards the country.
sentences.chinese: 能夠對本國盡職盡責的政治家實在不多。

sentences.english: However, it is to hear a little ring of mice, but also how much due diligence.
sentences.chinese: 可是它聽到老鼠的一點兒響動，又多麼盡職。

sentences.english: What I'm saying is, I did the best I could under extreme circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 我想說的是我在惡劣的環境下盡心盡職。

sentences.english: Responsibility and Trust form the foundation for healthy growth.
sentences.chinese: 恪盡職守和建立誠信，是健康增長的基礎。

sentences.english: It would also require crowdfunding platforms to conduct due-diligence on companies raising capital.
sentences.chinese: 這就要求衆籌平臺要盡職調查融資公司。

sentences.english: They should have gotten the due diligence reports that we just heard described.
sentences.chinese: 他們應該已經得到了如我們剛纔所說的盡職報告。

sentences.english: The people who serve in the military are giving their best to this country.
sentences.chinese: 我們的軍人正爲我國盡忠盡職。

definition: (Tw) to guide sb in the right direction/to correct (behavior etc)
see 念念不忘[nian4 nian4 bu4 wang4]
to put forward plans and ideas (also derogatory)/to give advice (idiom)
benevolent heart and skillful execution (idiom, from Mencius); charitable in thought and deed
to take turns/to work by roster
to be at the highest level of enlightenment (Buddhist expression)
